Class Zoo

  • java.lang.Object
    • Zoo

  • public class Zoo
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to represent a zoo. Holds a list of animals that are present at the zoo.
    Version:
    2018-09-14
    Author:
    Feras Salous

    • Field Detail

      • animals

        private Animal[] animals
        Array to keep track of all of the Zoo's animals. The size of the animals array represents the capacity of the zoo - the maximum number of animals that the zoo can hold. There may be fewer animals in the zoo than the zoo's current capacity. The zoo's initial capacity is 1 animal, but will be increased as more animals are added. Because there may be more empty indicies in the animals array than there are animals added to the zoo, currentIndex is used to mark the next location in the array to store the animal. e.g. The animals array is size 5, but only 4 animals are stored in the zoo. The animals are stored in indicies 0-3, but index 4 is empty. The value of currentIndex is 4 as the next location to store a new animal will be the 4th index.

      • currentIndex

        private int currentIndex
        The next empty location in the animals array. Used to store the next animal the zoo acquires.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Zoo

        public Zoo​()
        Default Constructor Initializes the array to a size of 1 Sets the currentIndex to 0

    • Method Detail

      • expandArray

        private void expandArray​()
        Increases the capacity of the zoo (the size of the animals array) by 2. Remember: an array's size is immutable - it cannot be changed. Instead, to "increase" the size of the animals array, you will need to create a new array with a larger size, copy over the data in the "animals" array, and update the reference of the "animals" array to the new array.

      • addAnimal

        public void addAnimal​(Animal ani)
        Add a single animal to the zoo. Adds the animal into the animals array and updates the currentIndex. Expands the animals array if there is not enough room to store a new animal.
        Parameters:
        ani - The animal to be added to the zoo.

      • getTotalWeight

        public double getTotalWeight​()
        Loop over all the Animals in the zoo to compute the total weight.
        Returns:
        The sum of weight of animals in the zoo.

      • getAverageAge

        public int getAverageAge​()
        Loop over all the Animals in the zoo to compute the average age.
        Returns:
        Average age (rounded down) of all animals in the zoo.

      • getSize

        public int getSize​()
        Returns the total number of animals in the zoo.
        Returns:
        The number of animals currently in the zoo.

      • totalAgeWithName

        public int totalAgeWithName​(java.lang.String name)
        Loop overall all animals and compute the total age of all animals with the given name.
        Parameters:
        name - The given name. The function finds the summed age of all animals with this name.
        Returns:
        The total age of all animals with the given name.

      • numberAnimalsOfSpecies

        public int numberAnimalsOfSpecies​(java.lang.String species)
        Loop over all the products in the customer's inventory and compute the number of animals of the given species.
        Parameters:
        species - The given species. The function finds the number of animals with this species.
        Returns:
        The number of animals of the given species

      • getAnimals

        public Animal[] getAnimals​()
        Retrieve the array that constitutes the animals in the zoo.
        Returns:
        The Animal array representing the zoo.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString​()
        Print out formatted information about the animals in the zoo.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A string representing the animals in the zoo. Formatted as: "The following animals currently reside in the zoo: \n" + for each animal in the animals array (starting from index 0), the toString of the animal
